Allow authentication by updating sbd client and adding a config.

candidates.title: chore: Bump version to 0.4.0
candidates.body:
Since the configuration change breaks the interface, I suggest bumping the minor version. 

I've created a `release-0.3` branch to maintain 0.3 if we need to

candidates.title: feat!: Make configuration typed
candidates.body:
The JSON configuration matching the [MDN recommendation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/RTCPeerConnection#configuration) really only worked with the Go pion backend. Datachannel uses a different configuration.

I'm proposing only exposing what is common. It does restrict the options that can be passed to the Go backend and requires an API change to add new options but I think what is gained by making the API clearer is worth that tradeoff.

candidates.title: Updated datachannel
candidates.body: Updates the datachannel version to 0.15 which contains the fix https://github.com/lerouxrgd/datachannel-rs/pull/41.

candidates.title: Bump sbd to 0.0.12-alpha and bump tx5 version

candidates.title: bump to 0.3.1-beta

candidates.title: Maint 03 25
candidates.body:
- The flake is pointing at `holochain/holochain`. If we want a flake, we can add one that points to `holochain/holonix`.
- A clippy fix.
- My IDE was highlighting that a bunch of dependencies weren't used. It doesn't always get it right but in this case `make` still works so I think it has a point.

candidates.title: BREAKING: only use sbd messaging as a fallback for webrtc failure
candidates.body:
This is a BREAKING protocol change because if you mix old an new peers, the old peers will send sbd messages that will immediately cause new peers to break out of webrtc mode.

- Switch default backend to libdatachannel
- Before sending any messages, attempt first to connect to webrtc. If unsuccessful, fall back to messaging over sbd.

candidates.title: feat: Make vendored feature for libdatachannel optional
bump sbd
candidates.body: haha, well this ended up being very easy.

candidates.title: libdatachannel backend impl
candidates.body:
RESOLVES https://github.com/holochain/tx5/issues/110

- Minor refactor of tx5-connection logic to enable swap-able webrtc backends while keeping the sbd signaling logic.
- Addition of libdatachannel as a webrtc backend
- Unfortunately, libdatachannel isn't immediately ready for production, so, keeping go-pion as the default for now, because:
  - windows ci has a flaky failure to connect over webrtc when libdatachannel backend is used
  - libdatachannel fails to build for the android target because it's not set up well to cross-compile

candidates.title: Bump Lair keystore to 0.4.6
candidates.body: Update Lair Keystore API and bump tx5 to release

candidates.title: abstract tx5 backend in prep for m̶o̶c̶k̶  mem backend
candidates.body:
- Actual mock backend PR to follow.
- There are a couple apis that aren't great encapsulation for the abstraction at this level, but in the name of expediency, I've just called them out in the code for now to be addressed at a later date.
- I'd love for the mock config to be configurable all the way up into the holochain conductor config, so I went with a generic `serde_json::Value` because those items will not be relevant to any other backends, but we need a shared abstraction. I'm happy to have feedback / suggestions of different ways to do this.

candidates.title: connection buffer and close fixes
candidates.body:
- updates sbd-client to include a rate-limit fix
- increases message buffer size on transition to webrtc
- fixes to slow app logic so connections are closed properly

candidates.title: Ensure SigUrls and PeerUrls are always in a canonical form with even well-known ports listed explicitly
webrtc upgrade for tx5 connections
candidates.body:
RESOLVES: https://github.com/holochain/sbd/issues/18

On new connection over the signal server, try to establish a webrtc connection. If successful, switch to transferring data over webrtc, otherwise, we just keep sending messages via the signal server.

candidates.title: sbd integration into tx5
candidates.body:
DEPENDS ON: https://github.com/holochain/sbd/pull/1
RESOLVES: https://github.com/holochain/sbd/issues/17

- deletes tx5-signal-srv - we will now be using sbd-server
- updates tx5-signal to be a thin wrapper around sbd-e2e-crypto-client
- adds crate tx5-connection which manages connections initially talking over the signal connection (and a placeholder to eventually upgrade to webrtc connections to be added in a follow-on PR)
- updates tx5 endpoint to work with tx5-connection-s

candidates.title: various tx5 fixes
candidates.body:
- support multiple iceservers blocks in `turn_doctor`
- account for possibility of multiple `Open` events on data channel in `turn-stress`
- fix multiple `sodoken` versions creeping in, and add a ci check to prevent that

candidates.title: Refactor of endpoint and connection management state logic
candidates.body:
- The main change of this PR is an inversion of the async driver for a tx5 endpoint.
  - Previously a central driver task would attempt to control all aspects, but the edge cases proved difficult to both reason about and test.
  - Now the main async driver is actually the `send` function. If we don't have a signal connection it will trigger creation of a cloneable future and await, following if there is no peer connection it will trigger creation of a cloneable peer connection future and await. The bulk of the complexity moves to ensuring these futures are cleaned up appropriately in error conditions.

candidates.title: build: bump lair_keystore_api
candidates.body:
Bumping lair_keystore_api in this package, because it doesn't allow `0.4.0` with the current version requirement and pulls in `rmp-serde` indirectly. Do you prefer `>=0.3.0` or `0.4.0`?
`>=0.3.0` allows for anything greater or equal to 0.3.0, major, minor and patch
`0.4.0` is `>=0.4.0 and <0.5.0`

- Only running x86_64 for now because it's faster and shows problems. Once those problems are fixed, we can up the timeout for starting an aarch64 emulator and running the tests on it.

Now we can see the actual errors that need fixing, namely:

- `thread 'state::test::extended_outgoing' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Custom { kind: Other, error: "[Custom { kind: Other, error: \"failed to run \\\"influxd\\\"\" }, Os { code: 2, kind: NotFound, message: \"No such file or directory\" }, Custom { kind: Other, error: \"no download configured for this target os/arch\" }]" }', crates/tx5/src/state/test.rs:53:14`
- `thread 'tokio-runtime-worker' panicked at 'assertion failed: flags.is_empty()', /Users/runner/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/rustix-0.37.20/src/backend/libc/fs/syscalls.rs:418:5`
